content.text: What is the Account Key for the Device Assignment credentials?

output.text: The Account Key for the Device Assignment credentials is "acrelec".

content.text: # ATP Market User Manual – Acrelec Documentation ## General - Users - Default Scripts - Blocked Scripts - Script Logs - Event Logs - Overview Alerts ## 5.1 General This section displays the Device Assignment credentials required to create a new ATP account on a device, as well as Publisher Contact Details for the brand. ## 5.2 Users This page displays the list of users assigned to this Market, including contact details and roles. [https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/) 20/146

content.text: If the status is not yet Available, select the reload status icon located in the top right corner until the status is refreshed. For direct cable connection: * Select Peripherals Setup. * Select Internet. * Check Current internet access value. * If the status is not yet Available, select the reload status icon located in the top right corner until the status is refreshed. Now that you have established the internet connection, you are ready to create a Nest account on this device. ### How do I create a Nest account? In the ATP Administration Panel, navigate to Account Management, select New Account, and fill in the form. All fields are mandatory: * Insert the Account Key and Account Password received in the registration mail. * Insert Operator name and Phone number. * Insert at least ten characters in the Comments field. * Select Save. A message that your account was successfully created is displayed, along with the unique identifier of the device used to create the account. ### How to restore an existing Nest account? If you previously had a Nest account on this device and now you wish to restore it, select the restore account option. You will be asked to supply the device identifier that was previously used. The device identifier is found in the Individual device data > General information section (see Acrelec Market > Devices for this information). Selecting the restore option will revert the device to its last known state. ### I had a key and password, but lost them and deleted the email. What do I do now? The Account Key and Account Password for each Market are displayed in Acrelec Market > Overview (selected from the main navigation menu on the left side of the screen) > General > Device assignment (red square). 6/3/25, 5:53 PM ATP FAQ – Acrelec Documentation https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/faq/ 16/76

# ATP FAQ – Acrelec Documentation ## My account was created, but I cannot find my device on the Market. Where is it? Your device was created and is now listed under Unassigned devices. To have it assigned and visible in the Market: ### New Store * Go to Acrelec Market > Unassigned devices. * Identify your device. * Select New store. * Fill in the following: * Device name – the name of your device. * Device Description – a description of the device. * Store name – the store name. * Store Id – the ID of the store. * Store Description – a description of the store. * Select Assign device. 6/3/25, 5:53 PM ATP FAQ – Acrelec Documentation https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/faq/ 17/76

# ATP Market User Manual - Acrelec Documentation ## Unassigned Devices The Unassigned Devices list contains all devices that were not assigned to a store yet. Each device presents installations details in the green tags: operator name, operator phone, and description. In order to link the device with a store (existing or a new one), click on the **Assign device** button after you select the existing Store from the nearby dropdown list or create a new one from scratch. When assigning a device to a new store, you can either use the default settings or use the settings from another store that you can select as a template from the dropdown list below. ### NOTE Assigning a device will remove it from the Unassigned devices list. - **Is Replacement option** – the Is Replacement switch button has been implemented in the Devices dropdown list > Unassigned devices tab. [https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/) 97/146

content.text: 5/21/25, 2:15 PM ATP Market User Manual – Acrelec Documentation Toggling this new option allows new devices to replace old ones in case of hardware malfunction, hardware upgrade, or any other reason (needs statement). **NOTE** * To replace an old device, enter the old device Identifier in the Replaced ID field (see below), and click the Assign device button. * We recommend using the Restore Account functionality in Admin Panel to maintain a device history continuity. In order to link the device with a store (existing or a new one), click on the Assign device button after you selected the existing Store from the nearby dropdown list or create a new one from scratch. When assigning a device to a new store, you can either use the default settings or use the settings from another store that you can select as a template from the dropdown list below. **NOTE** Assigning a device will remove it from the Unassigned devices list. [https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/) 98/146

content.text: # Administration Panel ## I cannot access the admin immediately after device setup. After successfully creating an account, you are presented with the Grey screen. The Open Admin touch sequence does not work from this screen. When tapping on the left bottom corner, you tap the Restart Core button, which will take you into a Core restart loop. To get out of this loop: * Open Task Manager. * Close Egg process. * Close Core process. * Start Egg process. * Start Admin process. * Go to the Apps tab and wait for the applications to be downloaded. * Continue with your standard workflow. ## How do I create a new account? In the Administration Panel, go to Account Management and select New Account. At your user account registration, you have received in the email a key and password. Have them at hand as you will be asked for them in this step. Fill out the form. All fields are mandatory. * Insert the Key and Password received through the email described above. * Insert Operator name and Phone number. * Insert at least 10 characters in the Comments field. * Select Save. A message that your account was successfully created is displayed, along with the unique identifier of the device you used to create the account. ## Core stuck updating. 6/3/25, 5:53 PM ATP FAQ – Acrelec Documentation https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/faq/ 70/76

## NOTE * When Linking a device to a Master, the content of the device is replaced with the content of the master. * When Unlinking a device from the master the content of the device remains unchanged. ## 8.10 Unassigned Devices 5/21/25, 2:15 PM ATP Market User Manual – Acrelec Documentation [https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-market-user-manual/) 96/146

content.text: # Nest account (device) ## I have a device. What do I do with it? If the device meets the minimum criteria specified in [Devices – Minimum Requirements](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-devices-minimum-requirements/), then an ATP-Compliant Windows image is available. Ask your Project Manager for the proper image, and they will point you to the corresponding storage. ## Why do I need a specific Windows Image? A specific Windows image is needed to set up your device. The ATP Compliant Windows images are available at [Windows Images](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-devices-minimum-requirements/). After imaging the device, it can be used in a plug and play manner. The device imaging is a one-time process, and all further updates are made through remote packages. ## Where can I find the proper Windows image for my device? See [Windows Images](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-devices-minimum-requirements/). ## How do I login into the device Administration Panel? Once your device is imaged, you will be prompted to the ATP Administration Panel (or ATP Admin), which requires a key to log in. The key for logging into the ATP Administration Panel is calculated using the algorithm found in the Password to Enter Administration Mode section in [ATP Equipment Staging – Windows 10](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/atp-equipment-staging-windows-10/). If you need to access the Administration Panel later, tap the unlock sequence while facing the device. ## I'm in. Now what? Once you have logged in, you must set the internet connection on the device. ### For Wi-Fi: - Select Peripherals Setup. - Select Wireless. - Select your preferred network. - Insert the password. - Go to the Internet tab and check the Current internet access value. [https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/faq/](https://docs.acrelec.com/atp/atp-documentation/faq/) 15/76
